Perhaps it’s the CRAZY SHAD thrown by the flickering candles. Perhaps it’s the sound the WIND in the midnight darkness outside. Perhaps it’s t amplified HEARTBEAT of Phillip. Something gives an edge t scene. We’re waiting for something to happen. With a cry of triumph as something clicks into place, Phi sits back on his chair, his latest creation in his palm. We recognise the object of black wood and filigreed gold LAMENT CONFIGURATION, a hell-summoning Box from HELLRAISE The workroom door opens and Phillip’s wife GENEVIEVE ente Mid-20’s and beautiful, she is in her nightdress.
Is it done?
Done!
(yawning) Is it wonderful?
Wonderful!
(smiling) Are you brilliant?

(returning the smile) The finest toymaker in France! They both laugh affectionately. Beneath their words and t smiles, though, is an undercurrent of .. what? Anxiety? Uncertainty? Perhaps they both sense Phillip is involved something that he doesn’t quite understand.

What does it do? Proudly, Lemarchand manipulates the Box through various positions until, at a certain point, the mechanisms withi seem to take over and it moves itself into the final swas like configuration familiar from the previous films ... and remains sitting on Lemarchand’s hand. No chains, hooks, no blue lights, no screams of pain or pleasure. The interested smile on Genevieve’s face falters.
Oh. (beat) It doesn’t actually do anything, then?
(stung into cold defensiveness) It all but defies the laws of physical geometry! It’s my masterpiece! You simply couldn’t understand...

I meant no offense, Phillip. I’m sure it’s terribly intri It’s just... dull. I prefer your acrobats and lovers. Laughing disarmingly, she crosses to the shelves and acti some of the older automata. I was working to a commission. To very specific requests. Duke has what he wanted. Genevieve registers the cloak as Lemarchand heads for the door.

The Chateau Du Reve to deliver the box.

Because my work might be appreciated there. And it is the appointed hour. Opening the door, Box in hand, he sweeps from the room. Genevieve watches the door close behind him.
The appointed hour - Midnight! Aristocrats... (cont.)

A magnificent mansion stands in its own grounds. Below it lawns is a front gate. A SHADOWY FIGURE hovers at the gat beggar or derelict of some kind. The camera moves to show Lemarchand at the impressive front door of the Chateau.

As I say. Always more secrets. But a wager is a wager... She begins to loose the catches of her corset. De L’Isle moves to stand with Jacque. text: CLOSE ON a human arm, as a scalpel slices it and a pair o hands peel the flesh back, revealing the musculature bene WIDEN TO REVEAL a big room, its floor sawdust-covered and blood-soaked, and full of tables on each of which are SHE COVERED CORPSES. At one table, sleeves rolled up and working hard at his dissection, is AUGUSTE DE MARAIS, a 30 year old professor science and philosophy. He has no students with him but o his friend Lemarchand. Auguste is smiling broadly, having heard Lemarchand’s story. (Auguste continues his efficient preparation of the corps throughout their conversation)
A pity Mme. De Beaumont is dead these four years. You cou have sold her your story and given her another success to match her “Beauty and the beast”.
It is no story, Auguste! I saw what I saw, heard what I h The Box opens the doors of Hell!
This is the eighteenth century, not the dark ages. The wo is ruled by Reason. We’ve even got rid of God. And if the no Heaven then it follows, reasonably, that there is no H
I was at its very window last night! Auguste looks at his friend, hears the conviction in his voice.
Very well. Suppose for the sake of argument that what you happened, happened. A Box that opens the doors of Hell mu able to close them.
Scant comfort, Auguste. The Box belongs to people with li interest in closing such doors.
Then the solution lies - literally - in your hands. You designed a machine that you fear can bring forth demons.
Yes.
Then design a machine that can destroy them. As Auguste bends down to the difficult (and two-handed) t of pulling the corpse’s rib-cage open, Lemarchand stares his friend, his eyes suddenly excited.
INT. LEMARCHAND’S WORKROOM AFTERNOON

The workbench is littered with papers filled with designs drawings. They reveal a progression from the design of th lament Configuration towards something else. (off) Phillip? A visitor. Lemarchand looks up from his desk to the door. Genevieve there and, beside her, Angelique - at the sight of whom Lemarchand barely manages to conceal his gasp.
Princess.
Toymaker . A beat. Angelique looks meaningfully to her side, indicat Genevieve’s presence.

Do I make you nervous? How delightful.

(cont.) I want to watch your mouth make the shape of my n The light in the room seems to have DIMMED, to have coale around them, leaving the rest of the room LOST IN SHADOW. isn’t flirtation. This isn’t seduction. This is hypnosis. Lemarchand is almost dizzy, his fear forgotten.
Angelique... Her eyes fix on his lips as he says it. She’s managed to just the saying of a name an intimate, almost erotic, act
Good, Now we’re friends. I much prefer to do business wit friends.

I was delighted. Transformed. I want more, Phillip. And s my masters. (off his look) Men and women of power. Ready reward genius. Gold. Fame. The smiles of fair women...

The Duke is rich, I know, but his influence is not so gre
De L’Isle? (laughs) Forget him. An initial contact, that’ all. When I say “Power”, I mean real power. And when I sa “Reward”, I mean real rewards.
Great rewards are usually accompanied by great risks.
Your caution is justified. You will hear strange stories see strange sights. But you are not in danger. You are my friend. She raises her hand to stroke delicately at his face...
Friends can share things, Phillip. Secret things. Things wives needn’t know. Their eyes lock. He leans forward, as if to claim a kiss.

We shall make great things and see great wonders, you and (a beat) Tonight. The Chateau. A masked ball. Come. Meet patrons. Claim your future. She unlocks the door and opens it, revealing Genevieve. Lemarchand is gathering up his new sketches, ripping the and trashing them. Auguste’s voice stops him before he re the finished design.

Coming to my senses. You were right. Fairy tales. Tricks the light.

and he addresses Paul directly through the monitor screen
